snippet: The Mexican club Puebla said it would not release its two American defenders, DaMarcus Beasley and Michael Orozco, to join the United States national team for Wednesday’s exhibition game against Mexico in Glendale, Ariz.
abstract: Mexican club Puebla says it will not release its two American defenders, DaMarcus Beasley and Michael Orozco, to join the United States national team for an exhibition game against Mexico; decision does not sit well with United States coach Jurgen Klinsmann.
lead_paragraph: The Mexican club Puebla said it would not release its two American defenders, DaMarcus Beasley and Michael Orozco, to join the United States national team for Wednesday’s exhibition game against Mexico in Glendale, Ariz.

keywords.value: United States Men's National Soccer Team
keywords.name: organizations
